Lady Fiona Fraser (MSc Human Resources Management 1994) Honorary President

column1: Douglas Smith (BSc Hons Civil Engineering 1970) Vice President

column3: Your Graduate Association was founded in 1997.

All graduates, honorary graduates and honorary fellows of the University of Abertay Dundee and its predecessor institutions are automatically members of the Graduate Association.The Association works with the Corporate Affairs Office to encourage links and communication between all alumni of the University and the institution and its staff and students.

We strive to advance the education and career development of students past and present through various social and professional networks, while promoting the interests and development of the University of Abertay Dundee.

column1:
Graduate Benefits
10% off holiday properties with Cottages4you! new

column4: Want to escape from it all? Cottages4you offers members of Abertay’s Graduate Association a 10% discount on over 15,000 fabulous properties from castles to cosy cottages in the UK, France, Ireland, Spain, Portugal and Italy.

column3: Choose from a majestic castle in Scotland for you and 20 friends, a cosy cottage for two in the Lake District, or a fabulous villa with private pool on the Spanish coast. Stay close to home and discover the countryside on your doorstep, or explore further afield.

To search online, check availability and book your holiday property visit www.cottages-4-you.co.uk/abertayuni or call the holiday helpline on 0870 192 1751. To receive your 10% discount simply quote code ‘ABT10’ when booking.
The University of Abertay Dundee is not responsible for the content of external internet sites.
<ul class="style5">

column2: • Alumni Accommodation Out-with term time

column1: University accommodation is available to alumni at discounted rates. Contact the Accommodation Office on 01382 308059 for more information. You can also hold your conference, lecture or other event at the University at a reduced room rental charge.

We currently offer computerised guidance materials, a career information library, and a reference room. If you want to discuss your career with one of the advisers please contact the Careers Service. The Corporate Affairs Office is exploring the provision of a career network for graduates and students.
Become an external member of the library for just £12.50 per year.

column2: We can help interested members organise a Reunion/get-together in Dundee or in their area.

• Participation in the Graduate Association
    As a Graduate Association member, you can stand for office, vote in elections and participate in decisions of policy issues. The Graduate Association has a voice in University Court through the Honorary President Lady Fiona Fraser, former Vice Chair of University Court.
For £15, alumni can become life members of the Students' Union, giving access to bar, clubs and social events. Contact the Students' Union on 01382 308950 to get your life-membership card.
